alert.note: Alert for Leslie; Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 4:01PM EDT until August 01 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by overnight and early morning excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Bell, Harlan, Knox, Leslie, Letcher and Perry. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 400 PM EDT, Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harlan, Cumberland, Loyall, Evarts, Lynch, Benham, Wallins Creek, Rosspoint, Golden Ash, Kitts, Clovertown, Harlan Gas, Coxton, Baxter, Ages, Sunshine, Tway, Chevrolet, Putney and Elcomb.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
